column4: when i try to install kubuntu it doesn shows me the partitions i have made but only shows one partition .. that is the hardisk. now i used qtparted and it gave the following msg. whats wrong any help? ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ sudo qtparted    Error: Can't have overlapping partitions.
I'd try deleting the partion and recreating them.  Sometimes rebooting after messing with the partitions helps
i have data in them. i will get deleted if i recreated them
you were installing ubuntu on a partition you have data on?
i have other partitions on a hd. and i want to install ubuntu on one of them. but the installed or g/qtparted isnot showing any partitions. just the hd.
hmmmm.... sounds like the partition table got messed up.  I would test the harddrive first
how would you check the hd
I use UBCD http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/ ... Seagate puts out a harddrive diagnostic tool
and ya. when runing windows. it got held 2 times.
hmmm... I might not be able to help you.  I don't believe I ever ran into that situation.... And I work as a repair shop that uses linux a lot.
I would still test the drive
which tool do you sue again?
